comment.author: 54017078@N00
comment._content: What a lovely scene. I'm getting vibes from southern Sweden (Småland?), maybe because it reminds me of "Emil i Lönneberga"! Or maybe further south? I wonder if the (very cool) thatched roof could be a clue as to where it was taken? The boy's clogs? And the way the two buildings are joined together like that, that seems atypical for most of Sweden.

comment.author: 34419668@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/54017078@N00] I'm glad you like the image! As you suggest; the clogs, the thatched roof and the way the buildings are joined together points to southern Sweden... (Halland?) Besides, Salfon Almquist, a probable originator of the photograph, had his early studio in Helsingborg in Skåne. /Anna B.
